queText: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?

ansChoice.A: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) costs are billed on a monthly basis.
ansChoice.B: Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances.
ansChoice.C: Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.
ansChoice.D: Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads.

ansCommentary: The ability to launch instances on-demand when needed allows customers launch and terminate instances in response to a varying workload. This is a more economical practice than purchasing enough on-premises servers to handle the peak load.

queText: Which AWS service would simplify migration of a database to AWS?
Which AWS offering enables customers to find, buy, and immediately start using software solutions in their AWS environment?
